name: mw17 - a 'notpainting'
description:
1:1
2021
4950x4950px


This is my first ‘a notPainting’.

I make digital abstract art.

NFTArt? Yes.

CryptoArt? Yes

Abstract Art? Yes?

Digital? 2d? Yup and mm-hmm. 

Painting? No.

Why not?  “Because I don’t use paint.” 

I’m aware that I’m pushing myself still further to the margins of all things nft art - I’m already committed to Clean only NFT! 

My collectors appreciate rare. They’ll have to. 

But we’re early as everyone says so I’m setting out my stall, virtual as that may be. 

My work is not painting and it doesn’t need to be. Painting is alive and well and living in tubes and pots and cans and buckets. It’s often applied with brushes and knives and guns and breasts. The  substrate? You name it. 

My colours come from pixels and illumination . 
My shapes and lines and details come from editing tools. From copy and cut and stretch and liquify and saturate etc…

I want to explore just exactly what non-generative digital abstraction is. 

Clement Greenberg and his inherent properties quote is applicable here. 

I like to use #abstrktobjkt
